description.value:
"Blessed be the Maker and his water, Bless the coming and going of him."
Hajra-Ikhut (roughly translating to "Journey to Seek Water, or He who journeys to seek Water") is the patron deity of the nomadic tribe(s) known to others as Water Nomads. He is depicted as a massive worm, whose maw contains the upper body of a withered, dehydrated man. Hajra-Ikhut is said to wander the deserts, eternally in search of water to quench his thirst- unaware that in his wake he leaves a trail of water.
The Water Nomads 'follow' Hajra-Ikhut's path, for they see his passing in the presence of scattered oases and rare, blessed rainfall. He is a deity who demands little, but gives little in return- and this is how the Water Nomads prefer things.


Edicts stay on the move, put the health of the tribe over your own, share water wherever you find it
Anathema allow yourself to grow complacent or sedentary, put yourself before the tribe, waste or destroy water
Follower Alignments N
